channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WA

item.title: Report E-2023060817
item.description:
Report E-2023060817

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-01
  • City: SEATTLE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORTHSTAR CHEMICAL, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Incident was not a result of equipment failure, was due to contaminate in the sodium hypochlorite which caused the natural decomposition to be accelerated thus increasing pressure in the CTMV during transit. The increased pressure in conjunction with liquid sloshing during transit caused PRV valve to open and re-seat as designed allowing pressure/liquid to release.

item.title: Report X-2023061524
item.description:
Report X-2023061524

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-21
  • City: TACOMA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: As package was being unload the package handler noticed a strong smell of gas and the bottom of the box was wet. DescribePack: Dented side near the top caused can to lift up the lid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once package was discovered it was placed inside a hazmat tote, taken to the damaged hazmat cage, then set under the vent.

item.title: Report X-2023061116
item.description:

  • City: TACOMA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: As the package handler was unloading the package they noticed the bottom of the package was wet. DescribePack: Loose caps were discovered. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once package was discovered the package was placed inside a hazmat tote, taken to the damage hazmat cage, and set under the vent.
